lead_paragraph: After living in an underground chamber for 69 days, completing a marathon probably doesn't seem like that big a deal. And so Edison Peña, the Chilean miner who ran three to six miles a day during his confinement, will be standing on the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge on Sunday morning with the other 43,000 runners in the New York City Marathon. "He might be running some, and walking some," a New York Road Runners spokesman said after the group heard from a Chilean consular official. Read about Mr. Peña's marathon plans in On the Run, The Times's marathon blog.
snippet: Edison Peña, the running Chilean miner, is coming to town.

headline.main: From Chilean Mine to New York Marathon

abstract: Edison Peña, the running Chilean miner, is coming to town.
